bug.author: nan-wang
bug.summary: ContainerPea fails to stop when replicas > 1
bug.description: During indexing, ContainerPea with replicas > 1 fails to stop after indexing completed.

comments.comment:
check out the codes at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jina-ai/examples/tree/webqa-search-with-container>jina-ai/example/webqa-search-with-container</denchmark-link> . run codes with python index.py Following are the logs /Users/nanwang/.pyenv/versions/3.7.5/bin/python3.7 /Users/nanwang/Codes/jina-ai/examples/webqa-search/index.py BaseExecutor@1444[I]:post initiating, this may take some time... Now this bug can be reproduced with the flower-search demo at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jina-ai/examples/tree/master/flower-search>https://github.com/jina-ai/examples/tree/master/flower-search</denchmark-link> . Replace the at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jina-ai/examples/blob/master/flower-search/flow-index.yml#L19>flow-index.yml#L19</denchmark-link> with any number larger than 1 will reproduce this bug.

Based on the following cases, I guess the problem is due to the wrong setup in the tail Pea when the Pod uses ContainerPea. In this case, the tail get inputs from tcp://0.0.0.0 and outputs to host.docker.internal, which is an internal Docker host. This leads to the problem of unresolvable host.
